channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: The kids missing the most amount of school may surprise you: kindergartners
item.description: A California school district fights chronic absenteeism in kindergarten by helping parents decide whether their kid is too sick to go to school.

item.title: Menendez brothers' parole hearings to begin Thursday
item.description: A California parole board on Thursday will begin two days of hearings to determine whether Erik and Lyle Menendez, who killed their parents 36 years ago, should be set free.

item.title: Gov. Bob Ferguson discusses AG Pam Bondi's demand to end sanctuary policies
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Washington state Gov. Bob Ferguson after he received a letter from Attorney General Pam Bondi threatening criminal prosecution for impeding immigration enforcement.

item.title: DOJ threatens legal action against some cities and states over immigration policies
item.description: The Justice Department says cities and states risk legal action if they fail to comply with federal immigration law. Democratic leaders are pushing back, saying their policies break no laws.

item.title: Are 'COVID kindergartners' ready for school?
item.description: More than 3.6 million children born in 2020 amid the COVID-19 global pandemic are walking into elementary schools across the country this fall.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Israeli military to call up 60,000 reservists as it plans to seize Gaza City, Pentagon officials meet with European counterparts over Ukraine security guarantees, Hurricane Erin lashes North Carolina.

item.title: This Kyiv woman survived a 9-story fall from her home during a Russian missile attack
item.description: "Maybe I have become a kind of symbol of hope": Ukrainian woman survives nine-story fall in Russian drone strike.

item.title: Former CIA officer and Army veteran discusses having security clearance revoked
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Joel Willett, one of the 37 former and current national security officials whose security clearance was recently revoked by the Trump administration.

item.title: Texas House passes new voting maps designed to give Republicans edge in midterms
item.description: Republicans in the Texas House approved the new voting maps that President Trump has asked for to give Republicans an edge in congressional elections. It's on track for final passage.

item.title: President Trump escalates criticism of the Smithsonian Institution
item.description: New York Times investigative reporter Nikole Hannah-Jones talks about President Trump's criticism of the Smithsonian, saying the institution focuses too much on "how bad slavery was."
